page.title: 20Trees
page.content: The small plantation at Fowler Hill is mainly poplar. It is thinned and managed by the Duchy of Lancaster. Dutch Elm disease has killed some of the elms bordering the A6. There is a good beech wood East of the motorway at Woodacre, extending almost to Scorton, and a small larch plantation,recently partly felled, near Burn's Farm. Most other common British species are found in the area, namely oak,ash,silver birch,pine and horse-chestnut. Hedges are mainly hawthorn with elder,honeysuckle, holly and wild rose.
